description: UMD 4.12.0 is a regular release of UMD 4. It includes an update of CERN Frontier for CentOS7 and SL6.
releaseNotes: The following updates are included in this release: <br><br><ul><li>CVMFS 2.7.3 - bug fixes and improvements https://cvmfs.readthedocs.io/en/2.7/cpt-releasenotes.html#release-notes-for-cernvm-fs-2-7-3</li><li>ARCCE 6.7 (only CentOS7) - enhancements and bug fixes http://www.nordugrid.org/arc/releases/6.7/</li><li>gfal 2.18.1 - https://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-2.18.1</li><li>xrootd 4.12.4 - some major big fixes, see release notes: https://github.com/xrootd/xrootd/blob/v4.12.4/docs/ReleaseNotes.txt</li><li>nagios-probe-bdii 1.0.16</li><li>nagios-cream 1.2.5</li><li>nagios-plugins-egi-notebooks 0.2.4</li></ul>
installationNotes: All products in UMD 4.12.0 were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria. Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.
contact: For further information about the distribution, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: operations (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the EGI Helpdesk (https://ggus.eu/) to make a report.
knownIssues: Please visit https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-4:UMD-4.12.0 for known issues.

products.name: arc.arc6
products.description:
The Advanced Resource Connector (ARC) middleware is an Open Source software
solution to enable distributed computing infrastructures with the emphasis
on processing large volumes of data. ARC provides an abstraction layer over
computational resources, complete with input and output data movement
functionalities. The security model of ARC is identical to that of Grid
solutions, relying on delegation of user credentials and the concept of
Virtual Organisations. ARC also provides client tools, as well as API in C++,
Python and Java

products.name: cernvm.cvmfs
products.description: CernVM File System (CernVM-FS) is a network file system based on HTTP and optimized to deliver experiment software in a fast, scalable, and reliable way. Files and file metadata are aggressively cached and downloaded on demand. Thereby the CernVM-FS decouples the life cycle management of the application software releases from the operating system. CernVM-FS is included in CernVM, however it can also be used outside CernVM.

products.name: egi.nagios-plugins-egi-notebooks
products.description: This is a simple probe that contacts a EGI Notebooks endpoint to get the latest status report of the service and return OK, CRITICAL or WARNING accordingly.

products.name: egi.nagios-probe-bdii
products.description: Nagios probes for monitoring BDII services

products.name: gfal2.gfal2
products.description: GFAL (Grid File Access Library ) is a C library providing an abstraction layer of the grid storage system complexity.

products.name: infn.nagios-cream
products.description: Nagios probe for CREAM (Computing Resource Execution And Management) Service. CREAM can be used by the Workload Management System (WMS), via the ICE service, or by a generic client, e.g. an end-user willing to directly submit jobs to a CREAM CE. For the latter user case a command line interface (CLI) is available.
